items.sentence: Tom thought Mary wouldn\'t want to live in Boston.
You need to be careful when you\'re driving a car.
You ought to tell Tom that you\'ll likely be late.
Tom spent the afternoon with friends on the beach.
Tom takes a shower every morning before breakfast.
Tom told me he wanted to live on a secluded beach.
How much did all the candy you ate last week cost?
I ate lunch at around eleven because I was hungry.
I could tell at a glance that something was wrong.
This is the first time I\'ve sent flowers to Mary.
Do you know how long Tom is going to be in Boston?
Do you know the name of the girl who was with Tom?
I learned to play guitar when I was ten years old.
Who will you give Christmas presents to this year?
Why would Tom have a problem with Mary helping us?
I get the impression that Tom is in love with you.
Tom told me that he would go to Boston in October.
Tom told me that he would never go back to Boston.
I\'m going to eat at a Chinese restaurant tonight.
I\'m looking for someone who can speak Portuguese.
I\'m looking forward to going to the zoo with you.
I\'m not sure what my children want for Christmas.
I\'m pretty sure Tom has already made up his mind.
Tom made it plain that he didn\'t want to do that.
Tom managed to put out the fire with Mary\'s help.
Tom called to say he couldn\'t attend the meeting.
Tom actually believed he could predict the future.
Tom advised Mary not to borrow money from anybody.
Tom always forgives Mary, no matter what she does.
Do you know any restaurants with good Korean food?
Later that night, Tom told Mary what had happened.
Tom said that he had eaten lunch with his friends.
Tom said there was something we had to talk about.
I think it\'s time for me to give her a ride home.
I think you\'ve got me confused with someone else.
Our profits have declined over the past few years.
People used to think that tomatoes were poisonous.
Perhaps Tom has already talked to Mary about that.
Please be sure to take one dose three times a day.
Students aren\'t allowed in the teachers\' lounge.
Tom doesn\'t know anything about raising children.
Tom doesn\'t know exactly when Mary will get home.
Tom always walks to school when it isn\'t raining.
Tom and I couldn\'t agree on what we needed to do.
Tom is in the kitchen cooking us something to eat.
Tom is one of the most disagreeable people I know.
Tom is planning on renting a house on Park Street.
I\'ll do my best to have the report ready by 2:30.
I\'m going to give Tom a copy of the book I wrote.
I\'m going to tell Tom what I really think of him.
